page.title: 13A LOCAL CONTROVERSY
page.content: The chipshop was at one time proposed to be closed. It was vital for the councils' needs. It lies on the Cupar Road and is very popular. A local lady set up a petition to stop the closure and managed to get 1480 people to sign it. After a few weeks it was decided that the chipshop was not to be closed. There was also an article in the paper about how the chipshop was to be closed and it caused quite a stir in Guardbridge. The shop stays open until 12.00 midnight and is doing very well at the moment. They have a lot of passing trade and the locals go there quite often as well.
